commitResults.messageTitle: Abstract print statements into their own class
Implement command echoing and exit functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
- Echo user commands back to the console
- Exit the program when the user types 'bye'

commitResults.messageTitle: Add feature to store user-entered text and display it on request
Abstract list functionality into own class
Add functionality to mark and unmark tasks as done
commitResults.messageBody:
- Abstract functionality of Task into Task class
- Update List class to use an array of Task instead of Strings
- Refactor main loop to use switch case for command branching
- Add string parsing to handle mark and unmark commands with numbers

commitResults.messageTitle: Correct boundary check, abstract logic, clean up
commitResults.messageBody:
- Corrected faulty boundary check in List.java that was "taskNumber >=
  tasks.length", which is always 100, and changed it to "taskNumber >=
  size"
- Abstracted logic of maskTaskAsDone and markTaskAsNotDone into a
  separate method that they both call with a boolean
- Abstracted logic of printing status icon into getStatusIcon
- Changed name of taskDescription variable into description

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Print class as PrintUtils class
commitResults.messageBody:
Add print and println methods to PrintUtils class such that all prints
get called from the PrintUtils now. This is more clear than previously,
as custom prints would still call System.out. This makes the code neater
and cleaner.

Rename variables and methods to follow the coding standard

- Change the message for invalid Task number
- Change the message for adding and unmarking tasks
- Separate linebreak from the printTask method for clarity

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Task class with toString method
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously Task class had a method printTask(), which itself called
PrintUtils. This led to some ambiguity, and removed flexibility in how
it was being handled, ie if you wanted to further format it before
printing. Returning a String with toString makes handling printing more
outright and straightforward

Also modified setTaskStatus to reduce nesting

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Todo, Event, Deadline classes extending Task
commitResults.messageBody:
- Created three new classes (Todo, Event, Deadline) that extend the Task class
- Moved string processing for task arguments into the constructors of these classes. This approach keeps control flow in Jeremy.java cleaner, despite making constructors more complex
- Retained the default behavior of creating a generic Task for unrecognized commands. Note: This default behavior is not intended to be permanent and may be revised in the future

commitResults.messageTitle: Rename List class to TaskList, cleanup
commitResults.messageBody:
Cleanup
- Change some variables to be final
- Change the formatting of the logo string

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor switch statement with Command enum
commitResults.messageBody:
Change the switch statement from a String to a enum I defined as
Command. This inherently removes the "default" case, as any error
handling is handled by the enum. As such, it now handles errors using
the UNKNOWN_COMMAND value.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add error handling to mark and unmark
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add handling of mark and unmark commands with invalid numbers with the
use of an exception, handled in the setTaskStatus method
- Refactor prior error handling for checking of valid taskNumber to use
exceptions

commitResults.messageTitle: Create custom exceptions to handle errors
commitResults.messageBody:
- Create JeremyException class for other custom exceptions to inherit
from
- Create exceptions for empty argument, illegal command, and illegal
command format
- Refactor the switch-case to use try-catch to handle exceptions there

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor setTaskStatus to use custom exceptions

commitResults.messageBody:
- Change LINE_BREAK constant to use .repeat method from String
- Change NAME constant from jeremy.Jeremy to Jeremy, which is a
  byproduct of lazy refactoring from IntelliJ

commitResults.messageTitle: Change TaskList to use ArrayList instead of Array
Reformat saved strings to be more readable
Add handling for data folder not existing yet

commitResults.messageBody:
Didn't check before pushing to master, so there's an extra commit to
resolve the merge conflict
